# ringSegmentCount

**Instance Property**

The number of subdivisions around the torus ring. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var ringSegmentCount: Int { get set }
```

## Discussion

This segment count corresponds to the circle formed by the torus’ major radius or [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNTorus/ringRadius] property. A larger number of segments adds more vertex data to the geometry, creating a more smoothly curved surface at a cost to rendering performance.

The default segment count is `48`. Setting this property’s value to a number less than `3` results in undefined behavior.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Configuring Torus Properties

- **pipeSegmentCount**: The number of subdivisions around the torus pipe. Animatable.
